subject: Sales
title: The Hanseatic League
description: A quick, practical guide to The Hanseatic League.

hook.text: German merchant towns formed an alliance in the 1200s so powerful it could rival actual kingdoms.

buildup.text: The Hanseatic League dominated Baltic trade with standardized rules and shared merchant infrastructure.

discovery.text: They created trade agreements, quality seals, and collective bargaining centuries before corporations.

twist.text: The League collapsed when nation-states grew powerful. Merchants ultimately can't outmuscle governments.

climax.text: The Hanseatic model survives in modern trade alliances, franchises, and business networks worldwide.

punchline.text: Merchants in alliance are stronger than merchants alone.

quiz.question: What caused the Hanseatic League's decline?
options: Nation-states grew too powerful for merchant alliances
